en.title: Naruto
en.meta_title: Naruto Watch Order: Complete Guide 2026 (Naruto + Shippuden)
en.meta_description: The complete Naruto watch order. Naruto (220 ep) ‚Üí Shippuden (500 ep) ‚Üí 11 films. 3 watch paths with filler guide. Updated February 2026.
en.intro: Naruto is one of the Big Three sh≈çnen anime alongside One Piece and Bleach. With 720 episodes across two series, 11 films, and a notoriously high filler count (41% of all episodes), knowing what to skip makes a huge difference. This guide gives you three clear paths through the Hidden Leaf Village.
en.quick_answer: Watch Naruto first (220 episodes, skip most filler), then Naruto Shippuden (500 episodes). Films are mostly non-canon except two: watch The Last: Naruto the Movie after Shippuden episode 493, then Boruto: Naruto the Movie at the very end. For the best experience, skip filler arcs ‚Äî they're well-documented and don't affect the main story.

why_confusing.content:
Unlike many anime, Naruto has an unusually high filler count spread across both series. Here's what trips people up:
  • Filler overload ‚Äî 41% of Naruto and 44% of Shippuden are filler episodes. That's 295 episodes you can skip without missing the story.
  • Films vs canon ‚Äî Out of 11 films, only 2 are canon: The Last and Boruto. The rest are fun standalone adventures.
  • Boruto continuation ‚Äî After Shippuden, the story continues in Boruto: Naruto Next Generations (separate series, not covered in this guide).
  • The Last placement ‚Äî This film is critical. It takes place between Shippuden episodes 493-494 and shows Naruto and Hinata's relationship development.

dbz_vs_kai.heading: Naruto vs Naruto Shippuden: What's the Difference?
dbz_vs_kai.intro: These are two separate series, not versions of the same show. Here's the breakdown:
dbz_vs_kai.verdict: Both series are required viewing ‚Äî Shippuden is the direct continuation of Naruto. However, you can drastically reduce watch time by skipping filler. Naruto Part 1 filler can mostly be skipped, while Shippuden has a few filler arcs worth keeping (like Kakashi's Anbu arc and Itachi's story).

paths.name: The Essentialist
paths.subtitle: Path 1 ‚Äî Canon Only
paths.description: The core story without detours. Skip all 295 filler episodes. Best for viewers who want the essential narrative without padding.

paths.name: The Standard
paths.subtitle: Path 2 ‚Äî Canon + Best Arcs
paths.description: The canon path plus a few well-regarded filler arcs and the best non-canon films. The experience most fans recommend.
paths.includes: Naruto + Shippuden (keep good fillers) + 2 canon films + 2 best films

paths.name: The Completionist
paths.subtitle: Path 3 ‚Äî Everything
paths.description: Every episode, every film, every OVA. For dedicated fans who want to experience everything the Naruto universe offers.
paths.includes: Naruto + Shippuden (all eps) + all 11 films + OVAs

timeline.notes: Non-canon standalone. Safe to skip.

timeline.notes: Fan-favorite non-canon film exploring an alternate reality. Worth watching for Naruto fans.

timeline.subtitle: CRITICAL ‚Äî Naruto & Hinata's relationship
timeline.notes: Canon film that takes place between Shippuden episodes 493-494. Essential for Naruto and Hinata's relationship arc.

timeline.title: Boruto: Naruto the Movie
timeline.subtitle: The next generation begins
timeline.notes: Canon epilogue film following Naruto's son Boruto. Watch after completing all of Shippuden.

fillers.notes: Early Part 1 filler. Safe to skip.
Filler between Tsunade and Sasuke retrieval arcs.
Filler arc. Safe to skip entirely.
One of the best filler arcs ‚Äî Kakashi's backstory in the Anbu. Worth watching.
Essential backstory for Itachi Uchiha. Highly recommended even for canon-only viewers.

faq.question: Should I skip Naruto filler?
faq.answer: Yes, for the most part. 295 out of 720 episodes are filler. The main story is perfectly coherent without them. However, a few filler arcs are well-regarded: Kakashi's Anbu arc (Shippuden 349-361) and Itachi's story (Shippuden 451-458). Everything else can be safely skipped.

faq.question: Can I start with Naruto Shippuden?
faq.answer: Not recommended. Shippuden assumes you know all the characters, their relationships, and the world-building from Part 1. You'd be lost on character motivations and major plot points. Start with Naruto Part 1 ‚Äî you can skip filler to speed through it.

faq.question: Which Naruto films are worth watching?
faq.answer: Only two films are canon: The Last (after Shippuden ep. 493) and Boruto (after Shippuden ends). Both are essential. Among non-canon films, Ninja Clash in the Land of Snow, Bonds, and Road to Ninja are the most entertaining. The rest are skippable.

faq.question: Where can I watch Naruto?
faq.answer: Crunchyroll has the complete Naruto and Shippuden series, plus most films. Netflix carries both series in select regions. Hulu also has the full series. For films, check Crunchyroll first, then digital rental platforms.

faq.question: How long does it take to watch all of Naruto?
faq.answer: Canon only (skip all filler): roughly 220 hours. Standard experience (skip most filler, keep good arcs + canon films): around 240 hours. Completionist path (everything): 340+ hours. Most fans complete the canon-only path in 3-4 months watching 2-3 episodes daily.

faq.question: Do I need to watch Boruto after Naruto?
faq.answer: Not required. Naruto's story concludes satisfyingly at the end of Shippuden. Boruto is a sequel series focused on the next generation. Watch Boruto: Naruto the Movie first ‚Äî if you enjoy it, the Boruto series might be for you. If not, you're not missing Naruto's conclusion.

streaming.cta: Start Watching on Crunchyroll ‚Äî 14 Days Free

manga.title: Want to go further? Continue with the manga.
manga.description: The Naruto manga is complete at 700 chapters, ending at the same point as the anime. However, the sequel series Boruto: Naruto Next Generations continues the story with Naruto's son. The Boruto manga is ongoing and often ahead of the anime, making it a great way to continue if you loved Naruto's world.

faq.question: Faut-il sauter les fillers de Naruto ?
faq.answer: Oui, en grande partie. 295 des 720 √©pisodes sont des fillers. L'histoire principale est parfaitement coh√©rente sans eux. Cependant, quelques arcs filler sont appr√©ci√©s : l'arc Anbu de Kakashi (Shippuden 349-361) et l'histoire d'Itachi (Shippuden 451-458). Tout le reste peut √™tre ignor√© sans probl√®me.

Vous seriez perdu sur les motivations des personnages et les points cl√©s de l'intrigue. Commencez par Naruto Partie 1 ‚Äî vous pouvez sauter les fillers pour avancer plus vite.

faq.answer: Seuls deux films sont canon : The Last (apr√®s Shippuden √©p. 493) et Boruto (apr√®s la fin de Shippuden). Les deux sont indispensables. Parmi les films non-canon, Ninja Clash in the Land of Snow, Les Liens et Road to Ninja sont les plus divertissants. Le reste peut √™tre ignor√©.

faq.question: O√π peut-on regarder Naruto ?

Hulu poss√®de √©galement la s√©rie compl√®te. Pour les films, v√©rifiez d'abord Crunchyroll, puis les plateformes de location num√©rique.

faq.question: Combien de temps faut-il pour regarder tout Naruto ?

Parcours compl√©tiste (tout) : 340+ heures. La plupart des fans terminent le parcours canon en 3-4 mois en regardant 2-3 √©pisodes par jour.

Regardez d'abord Boruto : Naruto le Film ‚Äî si vous l'appr√©ciez, la s√©rie Boruto pourrait vous plaire. Sinon, vous ne manquez pas la conclusion de Naruto.
